Working well now except for a couple of minor issues
"Donkey Pinball" doesn't work.  This is a small pinball table located on upper right.
Flipper has been repaired, so the game is playable again.  However, Fairy Godmother doesn't work, Fiona bonus doesn't work, and Pinocchio doesn't work.  Unlikely these will ever be repaired.
Out of order.  Right flipper sticks in upright position and only has around 1/3 power.  In addition, Fairy Godmother doesn't work, Fiona bonus doesn't work, and Pinocchio doesn't work.
Playable.  Fairy Godmother doesn't work, Fiona bonus doesn't work, and Pinocchio doesn't work.
Machine has been fixed and is working again.

Upper flipper doesn't work. Ball saver between flippers doesn't work. Pinocchio post doesn't work. Fiona award doesn't work.  Machine owner David George adamantly refuses to fix his machines but turns the machines on every week anyway to get money from unsuspecting people.

Ball saver between flippers doesn't work. Pinocchio post doesn't work. Fiona award doesn't work.  Machine owner David George adamently refuses to fix anything but tries to turn machine on every week and get money from unsuspecting people anyway. Bowling alley owner Ralph Curry doesn't care.

This machine has been broken for years without any repairs. Drawbridge is permanently smashed into the castle gate, along with lots of other issues. Owner refuses to repair it.

This machine is a total wreck. Drawbridge is permanently smashed into castle gate, thereby totally nullifying the point of the game. Machine owner David George adamantly refuses to fix his machines but turns the machines on every week anyway to get money from unsuspecting people. Bowling alley owner doesn't object.
